description: If present, indicates that the group or question containing the extension should only be enabled (allow an answer to be present and, in most circumstances, even be visible to the user) when the specified condition is true.

element.comments: If multiple repetitions of this extension are present, the question or group should be displayed when the condition for *any* of the repetitions is true.  I.e. Treat "enableWhen"s as being joined by an "or" clause.
element.definition: If present, indicates that the group or question containing the extension should only be enabled (allow an answer to be present and, in most circumstances, even be visible to the user) when the specified condition is true.

element.comments: If multiple question occurrences are present for the same question (same linkId), then this refers to the nearest question occurrence reachable by tracing first the "ancestor" axis and then the "preceding" axis and then the "following" axis.
element.definition: The linkId for the question whose answer (or lack of answer) governs whether the question is enabled.
element.name: question

element.comments: If answered=false and answer values are also provided, then they are treated as "or".  I.e. "Enable if the question is unanswered or the answer is one of the specified values".  If answered=true and answers are present, one of the specified answers must be met. (So there's little reason to specify answered=true if answers are present.).
element.definition: If present, allows the assertion to control whether the item is enabled when the question is answered or is unanswered.
element.name: answered

element.definition: If present, then the specified question must match the specified answer for all components present in the enableWhen.answer.
element.name: answer

name: Only allow data when:

element.comments: If multiple repetitions of this extension are present, the question or group should be displayed when the condition for *any* of the repetitions is true.  I.e. Treat "enableWhen"s as being joined by an "or" clause.
element.definition: If present, indicates that the group or question containing the extension should only be enabled (allow an answer to be present and, in most circumstances, even be visible to the user) when the specified condition is true.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

element.comments: If multiple question occurrences are present for the same question (same linkId), then this refers to the nearest question occurrence reachable by tracing first the "ancestor" axis and then the "preceding" axis and then the "following" axis.
element.definition: The linkId for the question whose answer (or lack of answer) governs whether the question is enabled.
element.name: question

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).
An Extension
element.name: extension

element.comments: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific.  This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

element.comments: If answered=false and answer values are also provided, then they are treated as "or".  I.e. "Enable if the question is unanswered or the answer is one of the specified values".  If answered=true and answers are present, one of the specified answers must be met. (So there's little reason to specify answered=true if answers are present.).
element.definition: If present, allows the assertion to control whether the item is enabled when the question is answered or is unanswered.
element.name: answered
